instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1534: What is A1534? A1534 is a model number for a 12 inch size Macbook  from years 2015, 2016 with EMC 2746, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00045, 820-00244..
definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message:
Came with broken screen, and broken connectors for the trackpad, i can order a new trackpad for cheap, but the J4801 on the board for the trackpad/keyboard i cant find anywhere, is there dead boards for sale?
It still turns on and boots.

Could not find the j4801 connector on the internet, or maybe a dead board?

I think that board is the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> but i actually cannot see it printed on the board, where do i find the model number?


Can i upload larger than 6mb pictures? JPG for me from the canon 1200d are ususally 7-9mb, i have to resize them all to upload.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message: Same connector as on <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> trackpads.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message:
now i dont have the macbook, i cant check it
are u sure the connector on the motherboard is the same? the trackpad cable is not symmetrical in the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, one end of the cable looks different than the other

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message:
ok, the macbook came back, i took the connector from a dead <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> trackpad, it fits on the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board
I ordered the trackpad, cause the connector is damaged on that too, but can i fix that with something? so the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> trackpad, it has 2 larger connectors, im looking for the one which goes to the motherboard.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message: You can solder to the trackpad without destroying it, just get a new one.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message: i mean the connectors on the trackpad are different, i cant use the connector from <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message: And I mean that you should not even attempt to fix a cheap trackpad.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1534</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> J4801 , 12inch macbook, trackpad connector,
threads.message: I ordered another one, but why would not i try to fix it, i fixed some DC board for macbook air too, that is cheap too, but we cant have anything in stock, usually for us takes at least 1 week until part arrives, if its easy i rather fix.
